response.answer_text: No, Spanish people are not white. Neither are Germans, Belgians, Russians, or any other Europeans. “White” is a racial classification. It does not exist on a biological level. Same with terms like “black” (why are Africans considered black but not black-skinned Indians?) and “Asian” (why are only East and South-East Asians considered Asian and never South Asians or Middle-Easterners?). Alright, if you don’t want an overly complex answer, then I’d say, yes, Spanish people are white. “Hispanic” is a linguistic classification, not a racial one. Hispanic means Spanish-speaking, so anyone could be “ Hispanic” regardless of skin-colour, so “Hispanic” is off the charts. Spanish people do tend to have darker skin than other Europeans, but so do Italians and Greeks. If darker skin defines racial classifcation, then by that same logic, wouldn’t lighter skinned Europeans (e.g Icelanders, Irish, Norweigans) have to be racially classified in a different way. Skin-colour is now off the charts. Finally, we’re onto ethno-geography. “White” is a racial classification for people of indigenous European ancestry or Europeans themselves. To exclude Spanish people just because they tend to have slightly darker skin is not needed — some Spanish people have skin as pale as German or English people, so seperating them because of skin wouldn’t be necessary. This would also apply to other Europeans who have slightly darker skin (e.g Italians, Greeks, Portugese), but they aren’t of question. So, yes, even if “white” is a social term along with other racial classifications, Spanish people are still white. It’s why people with full-Spanish blooded from Latin America are still classified as “white”. Even if their skin is a bit darker than other Europeans/European descendants, they’re still white, no matter how much they try to claim “I’m Hispanic” (not all Latin Americans do that, I know). TL; DR: Yes, Spanish people are white, even if they usually have skin a bit darker than other Europeans.

No, we are Spaniards a proud race ourselves. The ones who created the term white race itself, who sailed around the world for the first time, the crafters of European global mercantilism, the ones who stopped the Turks from conquering Europe and pushed the Moors outside of our peninsula, the ones who added milk and spices to that native beverage called chocolate because we found it sour and added churros to make it our breakfast, the ones who like to take siestas because it's really nice to sleep warm with the sun, the ones who run in front of bulls for the thrill, those who throw tomatoes at each other, make human castles and burn statues with the faces of our celebrities. The ones who sailed the ocean blue, the ones who do everything later, the ones who put olive oil in sandwiches but will kill you if you put chorizo in paella, the people that gave birth to Picasso, Dalí, Velázquez, Goya, Miró and many more artists, the creators of guitar that have people playing bagpipes like the Scots in te north. The first global superpower in history and the last western European nation to industrualise because we were crying about the loss for over a century. The land that gave birth to the best Roman emperor, the councellor of the second worst Roman emperor and the Roman emperor who built the wall between England and Scotland, and the Roman emperor that made Christianism legally the religion of the empire. The ones who stayed neutral in both World Wars but made our own Civil War in the meantime because we were jelous, the ones who had a fascist dicator for 40 years but were the first to be bombed by the Nazis, the ones who created the second most spoken language in the world and the ones who wrote the first modern novel in universal literature and the first professional army. The ones that conquered half the world, the ones that Napoleon called “exacerbated boys following a priest” while another French leader said about us “Spain gives birth only to soldiers". We are European, Latin, Celts, Iberians, Mediterraneans, we love the Mediterranean, the sun and Latin American music in parties (well maybe not that last one).

Is hard to say, because in Spain we are not used to all that stupidity of skin colors/minority. That is a “made in USA” kind of ignorance. We have our own stupid things, of course. We are more in the “culture” thing, and that depends of your language and accent. For us, a black american is an american, exactly as a white one. A person with american native look, is southamerican/latino if he speaks with any of the many south american accents, or spanish if he speaks with one of the many spanish accent. Same happens with white people. A black with perfect spanish accent is spanish. A unusually darker one, or whatever, but spanish. So, Spanish are multi coloured. White, black, red, yellow and kind of olive, some tones of brown, etc… Yeah, there are some levels of racism, and prejudice, by skin colour. But we don’t have it institutionalized, categorized, and elevated to that kind of silliness that you have there. So, this question, in its context, is absurd. You are trying to apply a concept that is american only to a place that doesn’t apply.

It depends on the spanish person. As you probably know, nationality and skin color are not the same concept. I am spanish, I have pale white skin. Some of my spanish friends have darker skin or even black. There are even spaniards with what we call asian features. Of course. Races don’t exist (but racism does, of course, and the effect that this racism has on people) skin color is just one of our personal characteristics. All the non black people comes from Africa. At some point people started to mutate to become lighter. The majority of people in what now we call Spain mutated to a skin color which is not as light as Scandinavians or Slavic. Which makes sense, because its way sunnier here. At this point in history, we have had many different cultures and influences so now we are pretty mixed and different. Some very light, some black and the majority like a bit tanned, not very dark. Only, its not a tan, they have this color. Now decide if you call that White or not. Who cares. Maybe this idea of White is culturally influenced and doesn’t really have anything to do with real skin pigmentation, isn’t it?

James Baldwin, an African-American scholar, said (quoting from memory): “The Norwegians that emigrated to the United States, were Norwegians. When they began to enslave Native Americans, rape black women, burn woods and poison wells, they became white.” Also from him: “If you insist on being white, I have no option but to be black”. Race, then, is nothing but an excuse to justify the privilege of some people, called “whites”, a privilege upheld through violence and exploitation. That's why I decided some time ago that I'm not white. If we talk about skin colour, you'll understand that belonging to a certain culture, and having a certain skin colour, are different concepts. There are dark-skinned Scots, Germans and Finns. And there are Spaniards of all shades, from albino to pitchy black. As a last thing: I don't understand those questions about nationality and race.

This is me  This is my father  One of my brothers  My eldest kid  My youngest kid  My husband  My sister Those are samples of spaniards , being me more on the less dark side , but not the blondiest Spaniard you may find , and my husband on the darker side , taking into the account that we live in a pretty sunny place and we ( my husband , my kids, my sister and I ) are a bit tanned . We really don’ t give a shit about whiteness , but this kind of question is tiresome , so judge by yourself .

YES No such thing as a Hispanic race. Only language and culture. Spain is a white country. In fact, it’s ‘whiter’ than Italy. DNA test from the people of Spain show that they’re mainly of Celtic, Italic, Basque, Frisian (German tribe) and Saxon descent. The only countries that come close to same amount of that mix of blood are Ireland and Wales. The remaining 25% of Spanish blood is made up of Greek, Near-Eastern, North African, Caucasian, Alanic, Georgian, Armenian, Jewish, Arabic, Greco-Roman, Anatollan, Mesopotamian, South Slavic, Sardinian, Germanic (Saxon), Germanic (Nordic), Slavic, Kurgan, Aryan. Italy has more North African and Arabic blood than Spain. Spanish is a white ethnicity. Go to Spain yourself and see the beauty of a country of made up of all of these white ethnicities. Here’s the DNA results of Western Europe including Spain. http://i.imgur.com/GLL0M9y.png

Yes. Also, no. They are “Schrodinger’s whites”. Spanish people (from Spain) and Latin Americans are an excellent example of how modern-day concepts of race, especially in the context of racism, are completely hollow. People of Spanish descent are alternately treated as white, or not white, depending on which is more “convenient” at the time. I’ll let you think about what “convenient” means. Like most other concepts that are associated primarily with bigotry, “whiteness” is not really a coherent, biologically founded concept. You can use science to determine that someone is part-Irish, or part-French, or part-Cherokee, but you can’t really measure “how white” they are. There’s no standard unit of whiteness - except, in some cases, lumens. “White” is a completely arbitrary label.

Yes. Probably not as “white” as (for example) Finns, but much “whiter” than (for example) people from the US. If it matters at all. Check for yourself: USA Basketball team 2016  Spain Basketball team 2016

First off, why does it matter. Second I said that because countries are countries, enclosure of people together under a national identity no matter what. So if I ask are Americans, Australians, French.. white makes no sense. They are just their own nationality. Third, because of countries being melting pots you can encounter features from most surrounding places. Because it is only normal. Whether people are more or less homogenous, it depends on how long interbreeding has been taking place. That said, in Spain you can find many people with hazel, blue-gray and dark olive green eyes, from milky white to taned skin, but mostly tanned in Summer. In general, people look fairer in winter due to the lack of Sun exposition. That is how it is. Our skin is adaptative and even then, we can get sun burn but never as badly as those who have sensitive pinkish skin. Our eyes mostly brown or hazel, are very adaptative to sunlight, and I think this is a good thing. Some people need to wear sunglasses out of necessity to avoid Sun damage. Our hair is usually dark, reflecting the Sun more than blonde hair, and it can shimmer really pretty.

In my view, for sure yes. They are western/southwestern Europeans, Spain is an EU member country, they are generally majority Christian (Catholics), at least ‘culturally’ when not actively practicing — as are most other Europeans some type of Christian cultural background or other, historically. They were long an important power-player in intra-European affairs and politics, including several major royal lines and so forth. They expanded abroad colonially, as did the English, and Portuguese, particularly into this western hemisphere where their language and partly their cultural elements as well spread to many non-white indigenous peoples — and their presence eventually led to a great many ‘mixed’ (Spanish and indigenous, etc) people who speak Spanish also.

I think that your question is too vague to answer. Spain has had so many influences. The ancient Celts were white but Spain had valuable ports on the Mediterranean they had many many immigrants going back to before the Romans. They were conquered by Romans who brought slaves from many parts of the world with them. That included Africans, Jews, and other peoples. Then, of course, there were the Moors who had been coming north from Africa for centuries before the Umayads decided to make Spain their own. Probably most of those people came from Arabia itself since the Umayads were related to Mohammed himself. But in my opinion the “original” Spaniards were for the most part white since they were of Celtic origin.

We are identical to the Italians, Greek, Turkish, etc. 2000 years ago Spain was dominated by iberians (mediterranean darks) in the East and celts in the West, the same celtic tribes from Wales, Ireland, Scotland, Bretagne, etc. Then romans came in and romanized them mixing more. They were here 600 years and when Rome fell in the V century, the germanic tribes took over, the so called visigoths, which means goths (germans) from the West (Visi = West). While the Ostrogoths (east goths) took Italy. Then in 711 the arabs from Morocco attacked from the south and took the entire peninsula until 1492 when they were defeated and expelt completely back to Africa the same years that America was discovered and the jews were also expelt for good. We haven’t had jews in Spain ever since and they hate us and want to destroy it in revenge ever since. That is why they support the separatists and communists that want to break Spain in many small poor countries to control it completely.
